description:
Poroban is a multi-disciplinary design studio, based off Old Kent Road, specialising in low carbon building design.
We are offering free design surgeries from the 9th Sept to 20th Sept and are hosting an open evening on Friday 16th Sept.

factsheet.heading: Free Design Surgery Sessions
paragraphs: We will be hosting a number of free 30min design surgeries during the period of Open House.  If you have an idea for a home extension, renovation project or a commercial development then we would be keen to discuss this with you.  Please bring along any material that may assist in the discussion (photos, plans, sketches etc).  We also have a range of material samples and other project material to aid in the session.
The link to book a session is here:  https://calendly.com/poroban/30min

factsheet.heading: Open Studio Evening Event
paragraphs: We are opening our studio on Friday 16th September from 6pm onwards.  All are welcome.  Drinks and snacks will be provided.

factsheet.heading: The Studio
paragraphs:
Poroban are designers and makers that work within the realms of architecture, urban design, furniture and installations for the creative arts.  We are progressive, inclusive and enjoy collaborating with diverse communities to create exciting spaces and neighbourhoods.  We like to work with local suppliers and manufacturers, and encourage a hands-on sustainable and pragmatic approach.
​
We are also here to combat climate change and seek to inform and educate via a multitude of mediums.  Poroban is a signatory of Architects Declare and an advocate for buildings with a low carbon footprint. We are particularly interested in materials with low embodied energy, promoting timber construction, passive environmental control and supporting local skills. If buildings contribute to 40% of total UK greenhouse gas emissions, then we have big part in producing solutions to reduce our impact.
​
Poroban is a promoter of diversity in the construction sector and has committed to the Diverse Leaders Pledge.

travel_info: Train: Queen's Road Peckham, South Bermondsey

name: Poroban studio
